intro: Hieracium murorum var. foemina, commonly known as the foemina hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers in clusters. The plant is native to Europe and is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and waste areas. It has a short stature, typically growing to about 10–30 cm in height. The species is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
